page.title: 14Housing / Armathwaite Hall
page.content: {Armathwaite Hall}owned 1,450 acres of land between {Bassenthwaite Village and the western end of the {lake } until 1930 when it was sold off in 34 small lots. It had 6 dairy farms, several small holdings, and {Castle {Inn. {Armathwaite Hall }was a very small building until it was enlarged in the 19th century by J.Boustead, who also had the long walls built round the grounds and raised the level of the road for privacy. { {Armathwaite Hall }was a noble mansion, occupying a delightful position in its magnificenetly timbered deer park. It has 4 lodges, and a garden that has overgrown.{ {Armathwaite Hall}is now a{Hotel.}It has a 'keep fit' centre for residents and locals who join a club. In the grounds there is a tennis court.
